result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah J Schieble was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Washington County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Bond amount posted in 16CF67 shall be applied and balance applied to 16CF159.  Any balance due in 16CF159 shall be paid as a condition of probation in this case. 

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then take medication as prescribed.

Defendant shall have contact with D.J.S. and C.F.S. as permitted by the probation agent.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall comply with sex offender registration.  

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Per Court Decision and Order dated March 19, 2018 sentence credit changed to 172 days.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Wilfred P. de Junco.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (16CF159 Br. 1; 16CF67 Br. 3)  State advises that a statute of limitations waiver is needed, discussion on case law.  Recess.  Reconvene.  Further statements by counsel.  Court grants amendment to Count 1 as previously ordered.  No contest plea entered to Count 1 as previously amended.  Defendant waives statute of limitation defense.  Court accepts the waiver freely and voluntarily.  Court dismissed Count 2 for read-in.    Court finds def guilty on Count 1 and enters judgment. Statements by counsel and defendant.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing
Arraignment on June 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Wilfred P. de Junco.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (16CF159 Br. 1; 16CF67 Br. 3)   Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  State indicates that Information has been filed as previous Information withdrawn and there are new charges pending.  Defendant waives reading of the Information.  Counsel anticipates entering a plea at the next court date.  Arraignment scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Atty. deJunco advised defendant will be waiving prelim.
